description: Vancouver is a runner's paradise, featuring a vibrant running community and diverse terrain, from the iconic Stanley Park Seawall to scenic trails in the North Shore mountains. With a mild climate and numerous run clubs catering to all levels, the city has run clubs offering anything from casual group runs to competitive training.

clubs.name: East Van Run Crew (EVRC)
clubs.description: A social run to shake out the Monday emeralds, starting from a different brewery each week.

clubs.name: Fraser Street Run Crew (FSRC)
clubs.description: Social runs open to everyone for a 5 or 10k social run.

clubs.name: Mile2Marathon
clubs.location: Point Grey Secondary School Track/Stanley Park
clubs.description: Offers top-notch coaching with twice-weekly interval workouts.

clubs.name: RUNVAN Run Club
clubs.description: A casual run club open to anyone who likes an early morning jog along the seawall.

clubs.name: North Shore Lions Athletic Club
clubs.description: A competitive running club offering training for all experience levels.

clubs.name: Vancouver Frontrunners
clubs.description: A welcoming club for all LGBTQ+ runners, providing social runs and training opportunities.

clubs.name: Steel and Oak Run Club
clubs.description: A run club that combines social running with craft beer and fun events.

clubs.name: Queer Van Run Club
clubs.description: An inclusive run club for the LGBTQ+ community, focusing on fun and fitness.

clubs.name: Vancouver Beer Run
clubs.description: Get fit, drink beer. Chill paces. All welcome!

clubs.name: Mondays Run Club
clubs.description: More than just a run club. MRC - Mondays. SOLE TIES - BE BACK SOON

clubs.name: Slowpokes Vancouver
clubs.location: Juice Truck (Sat), Nemesis Coffee (Wed), Lynn Headwaters (Tue)
clubs.description: Social Run Club with multiple weekly runs

clubs.name: Peak Pursuit Trail Crew
clubs.description: We run trails. Trail Thursdays and Sunday runs with rotating locations.

clubs.name: NRG Vancouver
clubs.description: Vancouver's Most Fun Run Club. All paces welcome. Free runs followed by social gathering at English Bay.
